entry.para: Element activity captures information on one or more process(es) applied to a Fedora object aas well as its completion status.

row.entry:
Enumeration:
" created " | " deposited " | " metadata_contribution " | " content_contribution " | " checked " | " machine_processed " | " user-tagged " | " rights_assigned " | " published " | " peer-reviewed/evaluated " | " withdrawn " | " deleted " |

entry.para: Activity categories or ‘primitives’ put together during workflow meetings in October 2010 (re: SB, SF, MP meeting on workflow values), and revised in November 2011 (MP). The categories are meant to represent a set of constant values to be used across projects to allow workflow general procedures to be applied to objects CWRC-wide without restricting workflow stamps (see stamp attribute).
Attribute status captures completion information on a particular process.

row.entry:
Enumeration:
" niso:AO " | " niso:SMUR " | " niso:AM " | " niso:P " | " niso:VoR " | " niso:CVoR " | " niso:EVoR " | " orl:SUB " | " orl:RWT " | " orl:REV " | " orl:RBV " | " orl:CAS " | " orl:CFT " | " orl:CFB " | " orl:PUB " | " orl:ENH " | " orl:TC " | " orl:PUBR " | " cwrc:cre " | " cwrc:dep " | " cwrc:cvr " | " cwrc:evr " | " cwrc:ckd " | " cwrc:tag " | " cwrc:rights_asg " | " cwrc:pub " | " cwrc:rev " | " cwrc:wdr " | " cwrc:del " |

entry.para: Activity types or stamps. These finer categories can be created on a project-specific basis, and particular projects may wish to rename these categories (i.e. Orlando may want to have ‘cas’ instead of ‘ckd’, another project may want to give it a stamp that according to a French name),, but the basic activities categories (primitives) should stay the same. NOTE: the values in the Activity type column are not exhaustive--more values can be created. The included values represent a minimum of stamps that can be offered as default to all projects.
Element assigned captures one or more assigned users and/or tools as well as optional note for next workflow steps.
Some id used to trigger a process by some tool.

row.entry:
Enumeration:
" created " | " deposited " | " metadata_contribution " | " content_contribution " | " checked " | " machine_processed " | " user-tagged " | " rights_assigned " | " published " | " peer-reviewed/evaluated " | " withdrawn " | " deleted " |

entry.para: Activity categories or ‘primitives’ put together during workflow meetings in October 2010 (re: SB, SF, MP meeting on workflow values), and revised in November 2011 (MP). The categories are meant to represent a set of constant values to be used across projects to allow workflow general procedures to be applied to objects CWRC-wide without restricting workflow stamps (see stamp attribute).
Element cwrc can hold a collection of workflow elements.
Element message captures notification messages to be sent to users and/or tools. Can contain subject and body.
Element note captures workflow notes for future reference of processes executed.
Element tool captures an assigned tool's ID.
Element tool captures an assigned user's ID.
Element workflow contains one or more automated or human-generated workflow records.
Attribute workflowID captures a string that identifies a particular workflow (set of processes to be tracked by workflow system) defined by users.
